vary.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other
vary.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Test scores vary from school to school.
The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
tests of varying levels of difficulty
flowers that vary in color and size
vary.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if something varies, it changes depending on the situation
vary.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
‘What do you wear when you go out?’ ‘Well, it varies.’
vary.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to change something to make it different
vary.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: My doctor said I should vary my diet more.
vary.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: The amount of food available varies considerably from season to season.
Farm sizes vary enormously within Europe.
The software seems similar, but performance can vary significantly.
The cooking time may vary slightly depending on your oven.
Prices varied wildly from store to store.
She was involved in a number of car accidents of varying degrees of seriousness.
Children with varying levels of ability can still be taught together.
a set of jars of varying sizes
Tap water may contain varying amounts of rust, grit and silt.
vary.translation[0].note_box[1].items[0]: Vary belongs to a group of verbs where the same noun can be the subject of the verb or its object
vary.translation[0].note_box[1].items[1]: In this sentence, ‘the interest rate’ is the object of vary
Banks can vary the interest rate
vary.translation[0].note_box[1].items[2]: In this sentence, ‘the interest rate’ is the subject of vary
vary.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if rates, costs, prices etc vary, or something varies them, they change when economic conditions change
vary.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Many professional investors vary the proportions of their portfolios invested in stocks.
The returns on bonds for the first five months vary considerably.
Premiums vary with the age of the person insured and length of cover.
vary.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other
vary.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Though estimates vary widely, analysts generally expect investors to earn between £1 to £2 a share.
The officesvaried in size from three to 14 rooms.
